divs: sighting details over the past two weeks i have noted a blinkingobject hovering very high in the sky northeast of the city of toronto. theobject can be clearly seen from our balcony, which is on the 30th floor of ourbuilding and faces east, and the object appears brighter than most stars. itappears around midnight each night in the same position and remains for at least1 1\2 hoursi have never watched it for any longer than that. it has lights that blinkconstantly and very quickly from white to green to redi cannot tell whether the pattern is random or regular. it is clearly not aplane or a helicopter although a casual observer might think so until s\he tooknote of the altitude and the fact that the object does not move at all. i haveobserved it through binoculars and believe the lights are positioned in anoval-shaped pattern but i have not been able to see what the shape or colour ofthe object is. i have driven outside the city to see whether i could see theobject better but the ambient light from the city makes it slightly moredifficult to see from the ground. however, i did drive some thirty miles towardit and never appeared to get any closer, which made it clear to me that theobject is very high in the sky. i have no idea what this might be, but sinceits appears so consistently in the same spot i was wondering if any otherreports had been made about it. thank you.
trends: There have been 136 other sightings in Toronto
